posts.name: Aiden Powers
posts.cooked: From venue match result to FIRST API match breakdown, has anyone measured how long this takes?
Never measured it but i have seen a some inconsistency sometimes it was pretty fast sometimes it was a few matches behind

posts.name: Ty Galle
posts.cooked:
Kully:

some inconsistency sometimes it was pretty fast sometimes it was a few matches behind

Is it roughly the same for each given event? Or, does it fluctuate a lot?

posts.name: Peter Cooper Jr.
posts.cooked: If all is going well (venue Internet working, FMS working, FRC back-end working) it should be at basically the same time as the scores are being posted on the big screen in the venue. There are no guarantees that everything will be going well, though, and sometimes it may take some time for the synchronizing of data to catch up on the FRC back end.

posts.name: Austin Schweikert
posts.cooked: Is it not pretty instantaneous? Iâ€™ve scanned the QR code that they show on the match results screens a few times and usually can see the entire breakdown iirc.

posts.name: Stephen Ostermiller
posts.cooked:
This season it has been consistently under a couple minutes.  I havenâ€™t been measuring the seconds, a couple minutes is good enough for my purposes.

That is a big improvement from last year.  Last year it was common for events to stop uploading.  The data would be delayed by hours.  Sometimes only becoming available in the API after the event was over.
According to the post above me looks like im out of date and it was mostly fixed

posts.name: Stephen Ostermiller
posts.cooked:
FIRST announced at Week 0 that they had been working on improving the upload method as well as the backup upload methods.  They expected API data to become available quickly after matches this season.

Their improvements seemed to have worked really well.  I didnâ€™t notice a single major delay the entire season.  A+++ to FIRST for their work getting data from the FMS to the API.

posts.name: alst
posts.cooked: Also mentioned on the FRC blog: Notes Heading Into Week 1
Ohh amazing stopped using some of the data from the api because of the delays great to hear that is better now
